litematica_printer.config.comment.breakP: Execute breaking operations using packets. Reduces the occurrence of ghost blocks.§r

The percentage of progress required to consider a block broken (70-100%%%%). Higher values provide a more vanilla breaking experience but are slower; lower values are faster but may skip block breaking animations.
litematica_printer.config.comment.autoIn: Automatically enable remote container interaction if allowed by the server, otherwise disable it automatically
litematica_printer.config.comment.bedroc: Uses BedrockMiner mod to break bedrock (unavailable if BedrockMiner is not installed)
litematica_printer.config.comment.blockl:
Enter block IDs or translated names (current language), e.g.: §bminecraft:stone§r §bSandstone§r.
Prefix with §b#§r for tag matching (matches blocks by tag), e.g.: §l#logs§r.
Add filter conditions with English commas (e.g., §lGlazed Terracotta,c§r), where “c” = contains match (tries pinyin/direct match first; other methods not implemented).
litematica_printer.config.comment.catego: Master category containing all configuration items; view/modify all printer-related settings
Highlight color configurations (e.g., container sync/inventory highlight)
Excavation mode configurations (limits, whitelist/blacklist, block breaking rules)
Fill mode configurations (block lists, fill rules, selection range)
Fluid replacement configurations (target fluids, replacement blocks, selection range)
Core printer configurations (working interval, radius, iteration rules)
Shortcut key bindings for all printer functions
Block placement configurations (cooldown, skip rules, easy place, water placement)
litematica_printer.config.comment.checkP:
When enabled, the printer only processes blocks within the PlayerBlockInteractionRange.
Blocks beyond this range will not be printed/mined/filled to avoid cross-range operations being detected by the server.
litematica_printer.config.comment.closeA: Close all active modes; restore to Print mode if in Single Mode
litematica_printer.config.comment.cloudI:
Supports remote container interaction (server-enabled or single-player).
Replacement positions are the schematic's preset positions.
litematica_printer.config.comment.debugO: Output debug information to the console when enabled
litematica_printer.config.comment.easyPl: Use Litematica's Easy Place protocol for block placement
litematica_printer.config.comment.excava:
Prevent mining blocks in this list (Excavation mode only).
Enter block IDs or translated names (current language), e.g.: §bminecraft:stone§r §bSandstone§r.
Prefix with §b#§r for tag matching, e.g.: §l#logs§r.
Add “,c” for contains match (tries pinyin/direct match first), e.g.: §lGlazed Terracotta,c§r.

Excavation restriction type: None, Whitelist, Blacklist.
§dNone§r: No block restrictions
§dWhitelist§r: Only mine blocks in the whitelist
§dBlacklist§r: Prohibit mining blocks in the blacklist
§lIgnored when using Tweakeroo excavation presets.§r

Use Tweakeroo excavation presets or custom presets.
§dTweakeroo Presets§r: Use Tweakeroo's excavation restrictions
§dCustom§r: Use custom excavation restrictions

Only mine blocks in this list (Excavation mode only).
Enter block IDs or translated names (current language), e.g.: §bminecraft:stone§r §bSandstone§r.
Prefix with §b#§r for tag matching, e.g.: §l#logs§r.
Add “,c” for contains match (tries pinyin/direct match first), e.g.: §lGlazed Terracotta,c§r.
litematica_printer.config.comment.fill: Place blocks from the §6Fill Block List§r within the selection range
litematica_printer.config.comment.fillBl: List of blocks used in Fill mode. Enter item IDs or translated names (same rules as block lists)
Fill block mode: Whitelist Mode (use items in config list), Handheld Item Mode (use item in main hand)
litematica_printer.config.comment.fillMo: Facing direction of blocks when filling (applies to slabs, stairs, and other direction-sensitive blocks)
litematica_printer.config.comment.fillSe:
Working range rules for Fill mode:
§dSchematic Selection§r: Use the full selected schematic area
§dSchematic Render Layer§r: Only work within the current schematic render layer
§dSchematic Selection (Below Player)§r: Only process areas below the player's height
§dSchematic Selection (Above Player)§r: Only process areas above the player's height
litematica_printer.config.comment.fluid: Place blocks from the §6Fluid Replacement Block List§r at lava/water sources by default
litematica_printer.config.comment.fluidB:
List of blocks used to replace fluids. Enter item IDs or translated names, e.g.: §bminecraft:sand§r §bSand§r.
Prefix with §b#§r for tag matching, e.g.: §l#sand§r.
litematica_printer.config.comment.fluidL: List of fluids to be replaced. Enter fluid IDs, e.g.: §bminecraft:water§r.
litematica_printer.config.comment.fluidM: Treat flowing fluids as part of the replacement target
litematica_printer.config.comment.fluidS:
Working range rules for Fluid mode:
§dSchematic Selection§r: Use the full selected schematic area
§dSchematic Render Layer§r: Only work within the current schematic render layer
§dSchematic Selection (Below Player)§r: Only process areas below the player's height
§dSchematic Selection (Above Player)§r: Only process areas above the player's height
litematica_printer.config.comment.forced: Automatically sneak during printing to prevent accidental block interactions (e.g., opening chests, activating redstone)
litematica_printer.config.comment.invent: Whitelist of containers for the printer inventory; only containers in this list are recognized
litematica_printer.config.comment.last: Switch to the previous bound container
litematica_printer.config.comment.mine: Mine all non-fluid blocks within the selection range
litematica_printer.config.comment.mineSe:
Working range rules for Mine mode:
§dSchematic Selection§r: Use the full selected schematic area
§dSchematic Render Layer§r: Only work within the current schematic render layer
§dSchematic Selection (Below Player)§r: Only process areas below the player's height
§dSchematic Selection (Above Player)§r: Only process areas above the player's height (Default)
litematica_printer.config.comment.modeSw:
§dSingle Mode§r: Only one mode active at a time.
§dMulti Mode§r: Multiple modes can run simultaneously.
Reopen settings menu to see mode changes after switching.
litematica_printer.config.comment.multiB: When enabled, modes run by priority; lower priority modes pause when higher priority modes are active
litematica_printer.config.comment.next: Switch to the next bound container
litematica_printer.config.comment.openSc: Hotkey to open the printer settings menu (current interface)
litematica_printer.config.comment.print: Print blocks continuously while holding the bound hotkey
litematica_printer.config.comment.printB: When enabled, automatically break blocks that do not match the schematic during printing
litematica_printer.config.comment.printI: Place blocks without requiring a supporting block face (for decorative blocks without support)
litematica_printer.config.comment.printS: Global on/off state of the printer
litematica_printer.config.comment.printW: Print water by placing ice and then breaking it to create water sources
litematica_printer.config.comment.printe: Automatically disable the printer when the player dies to prevent unintended operations after death

Automatically fill composters with compostable items to produce bone meal.
(§lWarning: Consumes compostable items in inventory!§r)

Whitelist of compostable items for automatic composter filling.
Enter item IDs or translated names (current language), e.g.: §bminecraft:wheat§r §bWheat§r.
Prefix with §b#§r for tag matching, e.g.: §l#compostable§r.
Add “,c” for contains match (tries pinyin/direct match first), e.g.: §lWheat,c§r.
When enabled, place regular logs first if stripped logs are unavailable, then automatically strip them with an axe to save time
Automatically tune note blocks to the pitch specified in the schematic during printing

Number of blocks printed per game tick when §6§lPrinter Speed§r is set to §b0§r. Higher values = faster printing.
Set to §b0§r for no limit (may trigger anti-cheat on servers); enable §6§lUse Packet Placement§r to optimize.
When enabled, break extra blocks not present in the schematic during printing

When enabled, break blocks that match the schematic type but have incorrect states (experimental feature).
Examples: stairs/slabs with wrong orientation, vines on extra sides, etc.
Blocks fixable by clicking (trapdoors, campfires, etc.) will not be broken.
When enabled, check if the block below falling blocks (sand, gravel, etc.) matches the schematic; do not place if mismatched

Item retrieval time increases if the target container is in an unloaded chunk. Select a schematic area and press the hotkey to bind inventory.
The printer uses items from this inventory during operation.
Recommend placing a dummy entity to keep the chunk loaded.

Order of block traversal during printing:
§dXYZ§r: X-axis first, then Y-axis, finally Z-axis
§dXZY§r: X-axis first, then Z-axis, finally Y-axis
§dYXZ§r: Y-axis first, then X-axis, finally Z-axis
§dYZX§r: Y-axis first, then Z-axis, finally X-axis
§dZXY§r: Z-axis first, then X-axis, finally Y-axis
§dZYX§r: Z-axis first, then Y-axis, finally X-axis

Shape used for block iteration:
§dCube§r: Iterate in a cube with side length = §6§lWorking Radius§r (Recommended: 3).
§dSphere§r: Iterate in a sphere with radius = §6§lWorking Radius§r (Recommended: 6).
§dOctahedron§r: Iterate in an octahedron with side length = §6§lWorking Radius§r (for special structures).
Maximum time (milliseconds per game tick) allocated for block iteration. Set to 0 for no limit.

Check packet reception delay while the printer is working. If no new packets are received for more than 20 game ticks,
the printer pauses automatically and resumes when packets are received.

Core working mode of the printer:
§dPrint§r: Restore blocks in the schematic (including orientation, state, etc.)
§dMine§r: Mine non-fluid blocks within the selection
§dBreak Bedrock§r: Break bedrock in the selection using game mechanics (only works in specific versions/conditions)
§dFluid Replacement§r: Replace fluids in the selection with blocks from §6Fluid Replacement Block List§r
§dFill§r: Fill the selection with blocks from §6Fill Block List§r
§dReplace§r: Replace specified blocks in the selection with target blocks (configure replacement rules)

§b§lTips:§r Except for §dPrint§r mode, operation range is based on Litematica selection.

Cooldown time (game ticks) before retrying block placement at the same position after failure.
§c§lDO NOT set to 0! Causes repeated placement requests, server lag, or anti-cheat detection!§r

Retrieve items directly from shulker boxes in inventory to printer inventory.
Replacement positions are Litematica's preset positions; no replacement if all presets have shulker boxes.
Cooldown time (game ticks) for Quick Shulker feature to prevent server lag from frequent shulker box opening; set to 0 to disable.

§dSimulate Click§r: Right-click shulker box slot in inventory to open (requires server plugin support).
§dCall Mod§r: Directly call QuickShulker mod to open (unavailable if QuickShulker is not installed).

Maximum working radius (blocks) from the player. Higher values = larger coverage.
Linked to §6§lIterator Shape§r; automatic delays are added when set to 0 to avoid orientation errors for pistons/observers.
Not recommended for redstone mechanism printing.
Check if the block on the observer's detection face matches the schematic before placement; only place if correct to avoid observer failure

Working range rules for Print mode:
§dSchematic Selection§r: Use the full selected schematic area
§dSchematic Render Layer§r: Only work within the current schematic render layer
§dSchematic Selection (Below Player)§r: Only process areas below the player's height
§dSchematic Selection (Above Player)§r: Only process areas above the player's height
When enabled, skip placing waterlogged blocks (e.g., waterlogged slabs, trapdoors) during printing

Interval time (game ticks) between block placements.
Set to 0 for no interval (may cause server lag); recommended 1-5 for balance.
When set to §b0§r, §6§lBlocks per Tick§r option is activated (reopen settings menu to see).
Use packet sending instead of normal placement logic to reduce ghost blocks. §6§lNot recommended for general users§r (may cause placement errors).

Number of blocks processed per game tick (only active when print interval = 0).
Recommended 2-8 for balance; too high may result in being kicked from the server.
When enabled, X-axis traversal proceeds from maximum to minimum values

When enabled, Y-axis traversal proceeds from maximum to minimum values.
Mining mode uses reverse direction by default; enabling restores normal direction.
When enabled, Z-axis traversal proceeds from maximum to minimum values
litematica_printer.config.comment.putSki: When enabled, §6§lskip blocks in the Skip Placement List§r during printing

List of blocks to skip during printing. Enter block IDs or translated names (current language), e.g.: §bminecraft:stone§r §bSandstone§r.
Prefix with §b#§r for tag matching, e.g.: §l#logs§r.
Add “,c” for contains match, e.g.: §lGlazed Terracotta,c§r.
litematica_printer.config.comment.remove: Clear the bound printer inventory list
litematica_printer.config.comment.render:
Display current mode and processed block count on HUD while printing (excludes Fluid/Fill modes);
Show packet reception delay if §6§lLag Check§r is enabled.
Limit printer working range to Litematica's current render layer
litematica_printer.config.comment.replac: Print directly over blocks in the §6§lReplaceable Block List§r (e.g., grass, snow layers) without breaking first

When enabled, use live coral instead of dead coral if dead coral is unavailable in inventory.
If both are present, dead coral is prioritized for printing.

List of blocks that can be directly overwritten during printing (no need to break first).
Enter block IDs or translated names (current language), e.g.: §bminecraft:stone§r §bSandstone§r.
Prefix with §b#§r for tag matching, e.g.: §l#logs§r.
Add “,c” for contains match, e.g.: §lGlazed Terracotta,c§r.
litematica_printer.config.comment.storeO:
Attempt to return items retrieved from remote containers/quick shulkers to original positions when inventory is full.
Poor performance in 1.18.2 (may cause lag); recommended to disable.
litematica_printer.config.comment.switch: Switch the printer's current working mode (Print/Mine/Break Bedrock, etc.)
litematica_printer.config.comment.syncIn:
Record items in the targeted container when the hotkey is pressed.
Sync items from identical container types in the schematic selection to the recorded container.
Hotkey to quickly enable/disable container sync feature

Highlight color for container sync and printer inventory blocks.
Set to §l#00000000§r to disable highlight.
litematica_printer.config.comment.update: Automatically check for mod updates when entering the world for the first time
litematica_printer.config.comment.useEas: When enabled, use Easy Place for block placement. No need to enable Precise Placement separately.
litematica_printer.config.name.autoInven: Remote Interaction - Auto Enable Remote Access
litematica_printer.config.name.checkPlay: Core - Check Player Block Interaction Range
litematica_printer.config.name.printerIn: Remote Interaction - Set Printer Inventory Hotkey
litematica_printer.config.name.removePri: Remote Interaction - Clear Printer Inventory Hotkey
litematica_printer.config.name.replaceCo: Print - Replace Dead Coral with Live Coral
litematica_printer.config.name.syncInven: Remote Interaction - Sync Containers Toggle Hotkey
litematica_printer.update.available: Litematica Printer update available! Current version: %s, Latest version: %s
litematica_printer.update.download: >> Click here to download the latest version <<
litematica_printer.update.failed: Failed to check for updates. Please try again later.
litematica_printer.update.recommendation: It is strongly recommended to upgrade to the latest version to fix potential critical issues.
litematica_printer.config.comment.printM:
Replace specified source blocks with target blocks in the selection (Replace mode only).
Enter source block ID/translated name and target block ID/translated name (separated by English colon), e.g.: §bminecraft:stone:minecraft:oak_planks§r §bStone:Oak Planks§r.
Prefix with §b#§r for tag matching, e.g.: §l#logs:minecraft:oak_planks§r (replace all logs with oak planks).
